review: Sarchu (also known as Sir Bhum Chun) is a major halt point with tented accommodation in the Himalayas  on the Leh Manali Highway , on the boundary between Himachal Pradesh and Ladakh  (Jammu and Kashmi) in India. It is situated between Baralacha La to the south and Lachungla La  to the north, at an altitude of 4,290 m (14,070 ft).  “The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes……..Marcel Proust It is indeed a strange when photographers go to a same destination but each one comes back with different images. I surprised myself by noticing these rocks near Sarchu which I must have passed at least six times but never noticed them earlier. I suppose I was carrying new eyes this time!
name: Arunverma
